_frame_metadata.purpose: Project structure and module map for AI assistants
_frame_metadata.forAI: Read this file FIRST when starting work on this project. It contains the module structure, data flow, and conventions. Update this file when you add new modules or change the architecture.

description: Telegram-first personal assistant with voice transcription, Obsidian vault storage, Todoist MCP integration, and Claude-driven processing flows

architecture.type: event-driven Telegram bot + file-based vault + subprocess LLM orchestration
architecture.notes: Aiogram handles Telegram updates. User inputs are persisted to vault files and session JSONL. Heavy processing commands (/process, /do, /weekly) run Claude CLI with MCP config, then optionally commit/push vault changes.

config.purpose: Typed environment settings via Pydantic Settings

bot-main.purpose: Bot/dispatcher initialization, router registration, auth middleware

bot-handlers.purpose: Telegram handlers for commands and content types (voice/text/photo/forward/process/do/weekly)

services-storage.purpose: Vault file IO (daily notes and attachments)

services-session.purpose: Append-only JSONL session history per Telegram user

services-processor.purpose: Claude CLI orchestration for daily processing, ad-hoc requests, weekly digest

services-git.purpose: Git status/commit/push automation for vault updates

ops-scripts.purpose: Operational scripts for daily processing and weekly digest

vault.purpose: Personal knowledge data, goals, MOCs, attachments, generated summaries

dataFlow: Telegram update -> aiogram handler -> optional transcription/file download
Handler -> VaultStorage append/save attachment + SessionStore append
User triggers /process|/do|/weekly -> ClaudeProcessor subprocess call with mcp-config.json
Claude output -> Telegram formatter sanitization -> response message
On successful processing -> VaultGit commit/push (in selected handlers/scripts)

conventions.language: Code comments and docs are primarily English; user-facing bot messages are Russian
conventions.telegram-format: Bot responses use parse_mode=HTML with explicit sanitization
conventions.storage: Daily notes are markdown in vault/daily/YYYY-MM-DD.md; sessions stored in vault/.sessions/*.jsonl
conventions.security: Access controlled by allowed_user_ids unless allow_all_users=true
conventions.runtime: Run via uv and Python module entrypoint
